ANU.name: James O'Donnell
ANU.colleges: College of Arts and Social Sciences
interest: James is a demographer whose current research is focused on understanding and measuring social cohesion within and across neighbourhoods. His broader research interests include:housing and homelessnesslabour market and household dynamicssocial and demographic change.
ANU.biography: James was awarded a PhD in Demography in December 2019. This research was focused on measuring and understanding the patterns, prevalence and dynamics of different types of housing and homelessness.

publication.title: Does social housing reduce homelessness? A multistate analysis of housing and homelessness pathways [IN PRESS]
The Suburbanisation of Homelessness in Sydney, Australia
publication.source: Applied Spatial Analysis and Policy, vol. 11, no. 2, pp. 333-354pp
Identification change and its effect on projections of the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander population in Australia.  Journal of Population Research 32(3-4):297-319
